page.title: 17COLTON FARM NEAR WHITKIRK
page.content: At the southern end of Colton Village lies{Colton Farm}which is owned by{ {Mr.Terry.}He has about{40 animals}but Colton Farm is still mainly a{mixed {farm.}He grows crops such as{wheat, {potatoes, corn, grass for his animals {and rape for seed oil.}Mr.Terry's farm covers about{200 acres}and he employs two other men to help him in his work. The farm house is about 200 or more years old, as are the stables, but the barns and other buildings are of newer construction.{In summer}his livestock, mostly cattle, are outside but{in {winter}they are usually kept inside. When we visited the farm in June they were busy sorting and bagging potatoes, some of which would be sold locally but mostly for selling at the market.
